snippet: Disagreement among polls in the state is essentially disagreement about which Virginia will predominate on Election Day: "traditional" Virginia, which is more religious, rural, working-class and white; or "new" Virginia, which is more secular, urban,...
abstract: Disagreement among polls in the state is essentially disagreement about which Virginia will predominate on Election Day: "traditional" Virginia, which is more religious, rural, working-class and white; or "new" Virginia, which is more secular, urban, diverse and white-collar.

headline.main: In Virginia, It's Tradition Versus Change
